components.description: A person gesturing with their index finger between ear and mouth, used as a deaf sign in American Sign Language (ASL) and a number of other global sign languages. See also ü¶ª Ear With Hearing Aid.
components.title: Deaf Person

description: A person gesturing with their index finger between ear and mouth, used as a deaf sign in American Sign Language (ASL) and a number of other global sign languages. See also ü¶ª Ear With Hearing Aid.
title: Deaf Person

version.description: Unicode 12.0 was released on March 5, 2019. Emojis that require new code points for release are listed on this page. See Emoji 12.0 for the full 2019 emoji list. More about this update.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the deaf person emoji features a stylized figure with a light skin tone, depicted with a clear, forward-facing posture and a subtle, understanding expression. The emoji's clean lines and soft, realistic lighting emphasize inclusivity and the act of non-verbal communication, reflecting Apple's commitment to accessible design. It symbolizes understanding without spoken words, the ability to connect through other senses, or can be used to represent individuals within the deaf community.
